title: UDL-Based Instructional Design Course for Inclusive Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Basic Knowledge of Education Policy
context.additional_context: Mathematics curriculum design for diverse learners in small classrooms with digital device accessibility.

learning_goals: Design at least three multimodal representations of mathematics instruction applying UDL principles

Learners design a five-item rubric reflecting learner diversity (gender, cultural background, disabilities, etc.) for software development projects and apply it to at least three project deliverables (e.g., code reviews, documentation, team collaboration) to submit evaluation results.

Using digital tools (Figma, Canva, H5P, etc.), learners produce ≥3 types of customized learning materials (interactive content/infographics) explaining basic programming concepts and achieve ≥80% fulfillment rates in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

Learners write a 15-page lesson plan incorporating ≥3 learning activities that reflect inclusive education policy requirements (accessibility, diversity, equity) and achieve ≥80% fulfillment rates in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

resources: Educational Material Samples for Diverse Learning Styles

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
